From our best guess, we are using JUnit 3.2 - we only can tell by looking at
the Version.java file in the JUnit distribution.
 
When we tried recently to run tests using JUnit 3.8.1 (still under JDK
1.3.1) we got errors relating to the use of the assert method.
 
So we assume that somewhere between v3.2 and v3.8.1, JUnit refactored
because of the new assert keyword in the 1.4 JDK.
 
Our question is, what is the newest version of JUnit we could upgrade to,
without running into this issue? We simply don't have time to refactor our
code just at the moment, but we are making an effort to make sure we are up
to date with our 3rd party libraries.
 
Thanks,
Craig
